Example

Test the significance of the value of \(r\) obtained from the previous example concerning electric motor torque values. Use the \(5\%\) level of significance.

Solution

The sample size is \(7\) so we have \(5\) degrees of freedom. The value of \(r_{test}\) is given by \[ r_{test} = \dfrac{r \sqrt{n-2}}{\sqrt{1-r^2}} = \dfrac{0.46 \times \sqrt{7-2}}{\sqrt{1 - 0.46^2}} = 1.158. \]

From Table 2, the critical value for a two-sided test at the \(5\%\) level of significance is \(2.571\). In this case, since \(1.158 < 2.571\) we cannot reject the null hypothesis at the \(5\%\) level of significance and conclude that for the motor under investigation, there is no evidence of a relationship between torque produced and current used.
